Figure 2:This figure demonstrates the core components ofğ™¿ğ™°ğ™²ğ™´ğšŸğš˜ğš•ğšŸğš\mathop{\mathtt{PACEvolve}}\limits. We decouple idea generation from idea selection to enable easy hierarchical management of idea memory (Â§3.1). We also design momentum-based self-adaptive backtracking (Â§3.2) and crossover sampling mechanisms (Â§3.3) to foster long-horizon reasoning in evolutionary search and escaping local minima.

Figure 3:We show three prototypical trajectories from 10 independent trials. If the search process does not converge quickly to a good answer in the first few iterations, it remains in a local minima for the rest of the search. Variance across runs is also large.

Figure 4:Cumulative Boxplot Comparison ofğ™¿ğ™°ğ™²ğ™´ğšŸğš˜ğš•ğšŸğš\mathop{\mathtt{PACEvolve}}\limitsTechniques. The distribution of performance across 10 runs is shown, starting with vanilla append-only context management and progressively adding each optimization technique.

Figure 5:Head-to-head win rate comparison. Win rate percentages are shown for all method pairs, indicating the proportion of kernels where the row method outperformed the column method. Equal counts as a win for both methods; therefore, the heatmap is not strictly symmetric.
